I will now take in order, with one or two exceptions which will be noted later, the remaining instances in which an anarthrous Greek noun takes the definite article in the RV. These are i. 10 ὡς ἄνθος χόρτου παρελεύσεται ‘as the flower of the grass he shall pass away.'
